LEXSubDomains.LEXSubDomain: Instruments Used in Binding and Fastening

Glosses.Gloss: chain (made of metal) or rope (made of fiber)

LEXSense.Comments: In a number of languages a term for chain is simply metal rope. In other languages it may be described as linked rope in contrast with twisted rope, that is, a rope made out of some kind of fiber.|The phrase σειραῖς ζόφου ({S:06100200400020}) is admittedly a strange expression, and in some manuscripts this gave rise to a slight change in orthography (σιροῖς; see {D:1.59}) with the resulting meaning being ‘in pits of darkness.’ If, however, one adopts the text ἀλλὰ σειραῖς ζόφου ταρταρώσας, it may be possible to interpret the entire expression as ‘but he chained them in the darkness of hell.’
